item.title: Integrate Sublime in Git Bash (Windows)
item.description: the default terminal in git bash is vim. We can change it to sublime. open change editor section in git docs scroll down to Sublime Text (Windows 64-bit). Copy the git command on the right : git config --global core.editor "'C:\Program Files\Sublime Text\sublime_text.exe' -w". Don’t forget to change the sublime text directory path according to where you install sublime text in your machine. after this, everytime you want to change commit message by typing git commit, the sublime text editor will be opened.

item.title: Daily Update on My Journey to Get SWE Job
item.description: In this post I will write my daily progress to get a job or internship as software engineer (backend). Day 1 Saturday, 11 June 2022 learn java from jetbrain academy Day 2 Sunday, 12 June 2022 evaluation : need to increase my focus and discipline. learn java from jetbrain academy use todoist to keep me focus and not distracted after finishing a task Day 3 Monday, 13 June 2022

item.title: Build Static Website With Hugo and Github Pages
item.description: introduction A static website is one with stable content where every user sees the exact same thing on each individual page. There are tools to build static website, such as wordpress, hugo, jekyll, etc. In this tutorial i want to explain how to use Hugo to build static website. After you build the static website, you need to host it online. There are many services that help you to host your website online, either paid or free, such as netlify, github pages, heroku, etc.
